topic: Twitter deal is temporarily on hold, tweets Elon Musk
content: The world's richest person Elon Musk on Friday tweeted that his $44 billion deal to take Twitter private is "temporarily on hold". The deal has been put on hold "pending details supporting calculation that spam/fake accounts do indeed represent less than 5% of users", Musk said. Shares of the micro-blogging site fell over 20% in pre-market trading after Musk's tweet.

topic: Motorola announces edge 30 as the world’s thinnest 5G phone
content: Aiming to disrupt India's premium smartphone market, Motorola has announced the launch of edge 30 as the world's thinnest 5G phone with 6.79 mm thickness & 155 gm weight. The smartphone, starting at ₹25,999* offers flagship features like 144Hz 10-bit pOLED display & India's first Snapdragon 778G+. It goes on sale starting May 19 on Flipkart & Reliance Digital stores.

topic: Tesla shares dropped by 26% ever since Musk offered to buy Twitter
content: Shares of Tesla have slipped by 26% ever since its CEO and world’s richest person Elon Musk offered to takeover Twitter on April 14. The shares have plunged on the fears that Musk will get distracted with Twitter. Meanwhile, shares of Twitter slipped to $45.23 on Thursday, nearly 20% below Musk’s offer price of $54.20 per share.

topic: Employee fired by Twitter changes bio to 'unemployed'; thanks team members
content: The second top executive who was fired by Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal, has changed his Twitter bio to ‘unemployed’. In a now deleted tweet, Bruce Falck, who oversaw revenue, had written, “I'll clarify that I too was fired by (Parag)." Falck later thanked his team in a tweet thread and said he can't wait to see their future work.

topic: 73 of India's 100 unicorns have at least 1 founder from IIT: Report
content: Data shared by analytics firm Tracxn Technologies showed that 73 of India’s 100 unicorns have at least one founder from IITs. Out of these, the founders belong to seven of the 23 IITs, with IIT Delhi in the lead. About 21 unicorns have at least one founder who is an IIT Delhi alumni, followed by IIT Bombay, with 16.

topic: Blockchain behind collapsed UST, LUNA tokens resumes activity after 9-hour halt
content: The blockchain behind stablecoin TerraUSD, or UST, and its affiliated LUNA token has resumed activity after a nine-hour halt on Friday. The Terra blockchain had stopped processing new transactions for the second time in less than a day after UST and LUNA collapsed. Several crypto exchanges, including WazirX, CoinDCX and CoinSwitch Kuber, delisted LUNA from their platforms on Friday.

topic: Joe Biden was elected as people wanted less drama: Elon Musk
content: World’s richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Friday tweeted that US President Joe Biden’s "mistake is that he thinks he was elected to transform the country, but actually everyone just wanted less drama." Earlier, Musk had also said that he would reverse Twitter’s ban on former US President Donald Trump and said that the ban was "morally wrong".

topic: Tesla puts on hold plans to sell electric cars in India over import duties: Report
content: Tesla has reportedly put on hold plans to sell electric cars in India after the company failed to secure lower import taxes. Billionaire Elon Musk-led Tesla has abandoned a search for showroom space in the country and reassigned some of its domestic team, Reuters reported citing sources. In 2021, Musk had said that India has the world's highest import duties.

topic: Still committed to acquisition: Musk after putting $44 billion Twitter deal on hold
content: Elon Musk tweeted he's "still committed to acquisition" after he put on hold the $44 billion deal to take Twitter private. Musk has temporarily put the deal on hold while he awaits data supporting Twitter's claim that spam accounts comprise less than 5% of users. Twitter shares fell to their lowest level since Musk disclosed his stake after the announcement.

topic: CoinSwitch delists LUNA as it crashes 100%, CEO says 'meltdown is rapid'
content: CoinSwitch Kuber CEO Ashish Singhal on Friday tweeted that the crypto exchange is delisting Terra's LUNA crypto token after it crashed nearly 100% in the last 24 hours. "The last few days have been tough for all of us...The meltdown of the Terra ecosystem and LUNA have been rapid and devastating," Singhal said, noting that it is "a tough decision".

topic: Tesla shares gain after Elon Musk puts $44 billion Twitter deal on hold
content: Shares of Tesla surged 4% on Friday after its CEO and the world's richest person Elon Musk said he has temporarily put the $44 billion deal to acquire Twitter on hold. Tesla shares have lost about 25% of their value since Musk disclosed a stake in Twitter on April 4. Meanwhile, Twitter stock plunged 10% after Musk's announcement on Friday.

topic: My $2.8 mn is literally worth $1,000: YouTuber KSI after losing millions in LUNA crash
content: YouTuber KSI claimed he lost about $2.8 million after the cryptocurrency LUNA crashed. He revealed he had put $2.8 million in LUNA, but it plummeted to a new valuation of less than $1,000 in a day. Speaking about how previous losses made him depressed and seek therapy, KSI wrote about the recent loss, "But that's ok because I'm not dead."

topic: WazirX, CoinDCX delist crypto token LUNA after it crashes nearly 100%
content: Indian crypto exchanges WazirX and CoinDCX are delisting crypto token LUNA after it crashed nearly 100% in the last 24 hours. LUNA crashed after its sister token, TerraUSD or 'UST', a stablecoin that's meant to maintain a $1 peg, lost its peg. CoinDCX said that it has also delisted UST from its app with immediate effect.

topic: US theatre installs IR cameras to catch people filming nude scenes
content: US' Broadway theatre has installed infrared cameras pointed at the audience to see if anyone is trying to use a recording device during nude scenes. This comes after someone posted videos of actor Jesse Williams and co-star Michael Oberholtzer online that were taken during a nude scene from a play. The camera system will be monitored in real-time.

topic: Meta, Twitter asked to store proof of potential Russian war crimes
content: Four Democratic lawmakers have asked the CEOs of YouTube, TikTok, Twitter and Meta to archive content that could be used as evidence of potential Russian war crimes in Ukraine. In their letter, the lawmakers said such content "could potentially be used as evidence as the US...and international human rights and accountability monitors investigate Russian...crimes...and other atrocities in Ukraine".

topic: Most dumb thing: Musk on hydrogen as tool for energy storage
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in an interview dismissed hydrogen's use for energy storage, saying it's "the most dumb thing I could possibly imagine for energy storage". "I really can't emphasise this enough...Hydrogen is a bad choice," he said. He argued that "gigantic tanks" would be needed for storing hydrogen in liquid form, and gaseous form would need "even bigger" ones.

topic: TikTok sued by family of 10-yr-old US girl who died in viral challenge
content: The family of a 10-year-old US girl who choked herself to death allegedly while participating in TikTok's viral 'blackout challenge', has sued the platform. Nylah Anderson was found unconscious in her bedroom in December 2021. She spent five days in an ICU before succumbing to her injuries. Her family alleges TikTok's algorithm pushed the dare in front of her.

topic: Ex-eBay exec charged with harassing US couple pleads guilty
content: Former director of global resiliency at eBay, David Harville, has pleaded guilty in the US to five conspiracy and stalking counts, becoming the last of seven ex-workers admitting to harassing a US couple who spoke against eBay. The seven people participated in a campaign against the couple that involved sending them disturbing home deliveries like cockroaches and a funeral wreath.

topic: Musk liking Dogecoin causes people to have meltdowns: Co-creator
content: Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus took to Twitter to say, "I...enjoy that Elon Musk liking Dogecoin causes people to have pointless meltdowns because he isn't talking about their arbitrary crypto of choice, cloaked by frail moral superiority." Markus' tweet followed Musk's reply to another tweet by him. "It [Dogecoin] has potential as a currency," Musk had said.

topic: Robots may assemble UK's demonstrator solar power plant in space
content: The UK Space Energy Initiative has established a 12-year development plan that could lead to robots assembling a demonstrator solar power plant in orbit. This plant will beam gigawatts of power from space to Earth as early as 2035, the initiative's chairman said. The initiative was launched last year to explore options to develop a space-based solar plant.

topic: SpaceX shows Starlink's availability globally, India marked 'coming soon'
content: Elon Musk-owned SpaceX updated Starlink's availability globally, saying, "Starlink is now available in 32 countries around the world." It also released a map showing nations where the service is on the waitlist and others where it's expected to come soon. India, along with its neighbours Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Nepal, Bangladesh and Bhutan, was marked under 'coming soon'.

topic: Crypto billionaire reveals 7.6% stake in trading app Robinhood
content: Cryptocurrency billionaire Sam Bankman-Fried has revealed a 7.6% stake in Robinhood Markets, filings revealed. Bankman-Fried has said he doesn't have any intention of taking control of Robinhood. However, the filing also said he may "from time to time engage in discussions" with management. Shares of Robinhood were up more than 27% in after-hours trading following the disclosure.

topic: Tesla to face its 1st jury trial in US over fatal Model S crash
content: Tesla is set to face its first jury trial over a car crash after a US court rejected its request to dismiss a case without trial. In 2018, 18-year-old Barrett Riley, who was driving a Tesla Model S, died after his car engulfed into flames after hitting a wall at 116 miles/hour. The lawsuit alleges the car's battery was defective.

topic: Apple pins letters outlining employee benefits at US stores: Report
content: Apple has started publishing laminated copies of a letter in its US stores' backrooms highlighting and praising its benefits amid a union push, Bloomberg reported citing the letter. The two-page note outlines benefits such as vacation time, a 401(k) plan, product discount programs and health insurance. Each letter has been signed by the local individual managers.

topic: Global crypto regulation body likely in next year: IOSCO Chair
content: The International Organisation of Securities Commissions' (IOSCO) Chair Ashley Alder said global market regulators are likely to launch a joint body within the next year to better co-ordinate cryptocurrency rules. "There's a wall of worry about this (crypto)...at an institutional level," Alder stated. He added that the main concerns are cyber security and a lack of transparency, among others.
